CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 19, 1944, pg. 13, reads: "Eckstine Steps Out - Billy Eckstine, the romantic singer of songs, gives out in a characteristic manner as he sings his latest hit, 'Good Jelly Blues.'  Tight: A shot of the great new orchestra Billy organized. The girl is Sara Vaughn [Sarah Vaughan], torrid vocalist with the Eckstine ork.  Billy and his boys go into the Regal theatre in Chicago on August 18, and everywhere the band shows Billy wins rave notices.  He's got it. - Harris Photo."Aragon Ballroom was at 628 Penn Avenue.
TitMainTitle: Billy Eckstine conducting his orchestra with Charlie Parker on saxophone third from left, Dizzy Gillespie, Art Blakey on drums, Sarah Vaughan seated on left, Howard McGhee, and Tommy Potter on bass, Marion "Boonie" Hazel on trumpet, Lucky Thompson on tenor, Charlie Parker on alto, and John Malachi on piano  in Aragon Ballroom
